content.description:
The following question is based on the final section of a work for chorus and orchestra. The text of the excerpt, with indications of the main cadences, is provided below.
 line1The Lord of hosts, [repeated]2He is the King of glory, [melisma on “glory”]3 the King of glory, [cadence]4He is the King of glory,5 He is the King of glory,6 of glory. [cadence]
content.question: What type of cadence is heard at the end of the excerpt?

unit.text: 5: Harmony and Voice Leading II - Chord Progressions and Predominant Function

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Use symbols and terms to describe melodic, harmonic, and rhythmic relationships in performed music. (This skill is applied in describing these elements in a full musical context.)
